result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyron F Gruber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full out of bond
Paid in full out of bond.

Defendant Tyron F Gruber in court with attorney Mike Banaszak who appears for attorney Gregory F Rothstein.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requesting matter be set over for one more status hearing. Timelimits continue to be waived.  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 10:30 am.

State by ADA Patti Wabitsch.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Alme Boaz.  Court advises the defendant of the penalties.  Counsel waives reading.  State requesting $3000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $3000 signature bond w/conditions:  no alcohol; not to operate m/v w/out valid dl; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed; no contact with the Bridge Inn; not to possess any printers to manufacture counterfeit funds.  Court examines defendant on right to preliminary hearing.  Counsel waives timelimits.  Court orders matter adj to 5/13 at 10 am for status of prelim hrg.
